pullRequest.title: Remove nextToken from ModelPagination since nextToken is never exposed
pullRequest.bodyText:
nextToken is an AppSync detail, which should not be exposed in the public interface.   There is no way to obtain it from a response directly, so we can remove it from the ModelPagination object.
To make a request to get a "next page" of results, customers should obtain a GraphQLRequest via the getRequestForNextPage() method on the PaginatedResult object.  This request object is a copy of the GraphQLRequest used in the previous query, but with the nextToken added as a variable.   Then, customers can pass this GraphQLRequest directly to Amplify.API.query(...)
This also adds an additional factory method, so customers can do ModelPagination.limit(1000), instead of ModelPagination.firstPage().withLimit(1000)
By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.

commit.message: Remove nextToken from ModelPagination since nextToken is never exposed anyway

afterCommit.message: Remove nextToken from ModelPagination since nextToken is never exposed anyway

commit.message: Add AWSApiPluginTest for making a paginated query

Fix bug introduced in #540, caught by unit test

`null` is no longer a valid value for a QueryPredicate. QueryPredicates.all() should be used instead now.  Because `null` was still used, an IllegalStateException: Invalid predicate type error was thrown

nodes.bodyText: Is it possible to have a paginated result, that has no request associated with it?
